title: What can I use to learn sales skills as a beginner? - Sales & Personal Growth - Quora

response.answer_text: Four of the most overlooked musts for new (and often veteran) sales professionals: Selling is not about the product you sell, it is about people skills. You can have the best product, but without strong people skills you will risk losing the sale.Always be learning! A wise sales manager pointed out to me when I was new to sales, “Your are either green and growing, or you are dying on the vine”. Never, stop trying to further yourself.If you do not know an answer do not make it up! It is OK to admit you do not know something. The best approaches are to either search for the answer along side them or request they allow you time to research the information and get back to them on their question.Always, follow up. This is especially critical if you said you would. Many times in the sales process, we all desire to move on to the next sale. Following up, however, can help close a sale or cement a sale which you have already made. Also, it can often can lead to additional sales.If you are interested my blog is written for the Christian Sales Professional, but has great information for anyone in the sales profession.

As a beginner, you shall learn effective communication first. Regardless of language, the way we communicate decides the fate of the sales. After communication, it is the approach that matters. Customers/ clients are always to be considered priority. Approach them in their convenient time, place and way. Break the ice by speaking something that he maybe interested in so that both of you get comfortable and then sales approach can be made. For example, if the client has lots of pictures of god in office, talk about the temple or if client uses a mac, talk about its features and new models. This out of context words can help you in sales.

There are a few things you need to understand as you start your love affair with Selling! Yes that what it is….you fall in love with selling once you know the impact of it in your life as well your buyers life. It is a tool to create value and bring change in others life becuase only when you sell will your your buyer be able to improce his/her life, business, education, pesonl health, or any other part of their existence. So first thing you need to acquire is a contribution mindset. Approach your prospects with a mindset of serving and helping them not gaining a deal or earning money. Earning money is the outcome not the objective. Secondly you need to work upon your influence building. People buy from people. And in order that they buy from you they have to know, like and trust you. So work on your communication and personal branding And thirdly, acquire tactical skills that help you master objection handling. Know each and every feature, benefit, advanctage, customizations etc, that you can offer to your prospect and be ready to field any question that they throw at you with poise. Impress them by your knowkedge
